cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.CC, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the problem of PAC-learning decision trees, which is a topic in machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the difficulty of learning polynomial-sized decision trees, which is related to computational complexity (cs.CC). The use of product distributions is a common technique in probability theory and statistics, which suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-categories of data structures (cs.DS) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper mentions smoothed analysis, which is a technique used to analyze the performance of algorithms in the presence of small perturbations, suggesting that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of information theory (cs.IT).
